RAMESH5: E_r=               1e-299 Utildesq=                    0 Utildecon0=                    0 Utildecon1=                   -0 Utildecon2=                   -0 Utildecon3=                    0


ramesh.txt contains results from your code and the ZAMO function from radinv.c.  It's not meant to be easily machine readable, just human readable.  For each of the "failures" in the rameshfails.txt file, there are 14 RAMESH1's, 3 RAMESH2's, 3 RAMESH3's, 1 RAMESH4, and 1 RAMESH5 rows.

The 14 RAMESH1 rows are the output from my version of your code as called by harm.  The quantities are in the same order as in your code, but starting with 0 as in C (instead of 1 as in Fortran).  The velocities are in the lab frame as your code uses.  These are (as in my version of your code):

c     HARM order, starting with 1
      results(1) = rhofinal
      results(2) = ufinal
      results(3) = ugasconfinal(1)
      results(4) = ugasconfinal(2)
      results(5) = ugasconfinal(3)
      results(6) = ugasconfinal(4)
      results(7) = Efinal
      results(8) = uradconfinal(1)
      results(9) = uradconfinal(2)
      results(10) = uradconfinal(3)
      results(11) = uradconfinal(4)

      results(12) = failmode (i.e. faileng and failent)
      results(13) = error (i.e. erreng and errent)
      results(14) = iterations (i.e. itereng and iterent)

The 3 RAMESH2's are the gas \tilde{u}^i  for the solution from harm (i.e. from uu and pp)

The 3 RAMESH2's are the radiation \tilde{u}^i for the solution from harm (i.e. from uu and pp)

The 1 RAMESH4 is the results from the ZAMO calculation for E_r, \tilde{U}^2 and \tilde{U}^\mu when using the "initial+flux" uu0.

The 1 RAMESH5 is the results from the ZAMO calculation for E_r, \tilde{U}^2 and \tilde{U}^\mu when using the final jon (i.e. harm) version of the harm solution for "initial+flux+source" uu as associated with pp and uu in the fail file.
